channel.title: DevHawk tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from DevHawk.

item.description: They brought their fucking toys. #SlapShot https://t.co/boDRrSYN2J

"Optimism isnâ€™t principally an analysis of present reality. Itâ€™s an ethic. It is not based on denial or rosy thinking. It is a moral posture toward the world we find ourselves in. " - @joshtpm #IStandWithUkraine
I'm so glad @LastWeekTonight with @iamjohnoliver is back

I waz really impressed with #Peacemaker. I mean, I expected to *enjoy* it, but it hit a lot harder than that. Kinda felt like @JamesGunn made it *for me*. Color me impressed. I guess I shouldn't be surprised. #GuardiansOfTheGalaxy was very good, but #Volume2 took it to an entirely new level. Similar vibe IMO between #TheSuicideSquad and #Peacemaker - except Peacemaker had even more time/space to breathe and develop. [link]
"Refrain from feeding obsolete hungers" [link] https://t.co/UdeDmY6LgF
@schlummer2k I only use the mac mini for cross plat/arm64 testing. So it's no big deal when it's locked up for hours and hours updating itself
@k_eichinger @TeamViewer I will. Thanks!

I love @code. I use VSCode Remote WSL all the time, but somehow *COMPLETELY FORGOT* about VSCode Remote SSH. Setup was a breeze and now I can do 90% of my mac work from windows and without having to use macOS. I even installed Powershell :)
@timheuer [link]
Can anyone suggest a better solution for remote access *to* MacOS *from* Windows than Chrome Remote Desktop? Chrome Remote Desktop is serviceable but doesn't hold a candle to Windows Remote Desktop.

Uhhh... [link] Right after I took this screen shot, the estimate dropped to 18 minutes. Apparently Windows isn't the only OS that does a shitty job estimating how long operations are expected to take. LOL [link] That's <checks notes> pretty bad estimation [link] It was stuck on "about 1 second remaining" for long enough for me to notice, wait a bit, start a timer, launch the screen snip app, take a screen shot and for the timer to reach 1m22s. It did finish in under a day tho, so I guess I've got that going for me. ðŸ¤£ [link]
I would like to thank the Rams, Bengals and everyone working on the Super Bowl for finishing the game in a timely fashion before my hockey game ðŸ˜‚

I resolved my winget / PC Health Check upgrade issue by uninstalling PC Health Check via uninstall UI in settings app. For some reason, there were TWO copies of PC Health Check installed, which apparently confused winget to the point of being unable to update or uninstall either
winget: still not quite ready for prime time

ICYMI, winget still ... not great. Now I'm having issues with the Windows PC Health Check app. According to winget, I have v3.2.2110.14001 installed and v3.3.2110.22002 is available. upgrade --all downloads and runs an msi, but winget still reports upgrade available. PC Health Check about box shows it's been updated to 3.3.2110.22002 already, even if winget seems to think it's not. [link] Plus PowerToys popped up a dialog saying v0.55.2 update was available...right after winget installed (checks notes) v0.55.1. So winget mistakenly thinks PC Health Check has not been updated when it has AND it also mistakenly thinks PowerToys is up to date when it is not.
@tillig I've been meaning to experiment with Plex. Thanks for the suggestion
@vstuart Still appreciated
This is why Windows Runtime exists. [link]

I was the original dev for App Execution Aliases. So I was able to point @jandedobbeleer in the right direction to make #ohmyposh work with the Windows Store version of Python. No biggie, just helping out the @golang community without actually being a @golang dev ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£ [link]
@davemangot @TIDAL I can wrangle python
@davemangot @TIDAL Doesn't @tidal already have a playlist import feature?
@patrickallmond You know, I'm not allergic to hearing the word "Apple" . I got Jules an iPhone last fall and I've have a Mac mini on my desk at work for years (tho I rarely use it).

@somniumwave @schlummer2k @TIDAL Well, we can. I mean there had to be a local music player app on modern mobile platforms right? But having access to most music without having to rip CDs is just way too convenient to give up. It's been forever since I bought physical media and I don't want to go back now
@schlummer2k @somniumwave @TIDAL @HumswapNeo I don't think that let's me upload my own music (though playlist import is a nice feature to have)

@somniumwave Cc @schlummer2k what about custom tracks on @TIDAL? I have some music from old friends bands that isn't available on any streaming service. I used to use Groove Music from MSFT ('natch) and I loved the OneDrive integration. Spotify has limited support for this, but it's a PITA
@schlummer2k @TIDAL Thanks for the suggestion
